author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Additional District Munsif Court here adjourned the hearing in the plagiarism case against Rajinikanth-starrer ‘Lingaa’ movie till Thursday as the defendants sought more time to respond to the petition made on Tuesday by the plaintiff, K.R. Ravi Rathinam.

When the case came up for hearing on Tuesday, Mr. Ravi Rathinam, filed a petition through his counsel demanding the makers of the movie, the defendants in the case, to submit the original script of the movie in the court.

Judge N. Vishwanath adjourned the case till Wednesday to provide time for the defendants to respond. However, as the defendants’ counsel sought more time on Wednesday, the hearing was adjourned.

Mr. Ravi Rathinam filed the case alleging that the ‘Lingaa’ team had copied the script he had kept ready for a film named ‘Mullai Vanam 999.’

As the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court had earlier directed the court to dispose of the case by the end of April, the Additional District Munsif Court has expedited the trial.
title: Lingaa case: hearing adjourned
